summary:
Day something or other in my FiftyIn50 blogging challenge and today's question is:
What things are easy for you to write about.  What things are hard. 
As someone who has written literally millions of words and curated just as many since moving in to print and publishing, it's a mute point as to what's hard and what's not when it comes to writing...
title: A Million Words

summary: Tucked into yesterday’s announcement about the new 10-book contract with Tor is this notation: John Scalzi has become one of the most popular science fiction authors of his generation with 4. 5 million books in print in the United States.   Let’s discard the “one of the most popular science fiction authors of his generation” bit as […]
title: Some Number Crunching on Career Sales, 2024

summary:
Auto manufacturers are just starting to realize the problems of supporting the software in older models:
Today’s phones are able to receive updates six to eight years after their purchase date.  Samsung and Google provide Android OS updates and security updates for seven years.  Apple halts servicing products seven years after they stop selling them...
title: Providing Security Updates to Automobile Software

summary:
My wife and I drove to Nashville last night to attend the final show of A Day To Remember's The Least Anticipated Album Tour, with The Story So Far, Four Year Strong, and Scowl. 
Scowl was loud and kind of chaotic (in the best way), though not really my cup of tea. 
Four Year Strong played a solid set with great energy...
title: A Concert to Remember
